title: Fort of S. Felipe da Praça
original_title: Forte de S. Felipe da Praça
body: Ordered to be built by the bishop governor D. Jerónimo Fernando in 1628, between the mouths of the Ribeira de João Gomes and Santa Luzia and to the south of the Pelourinho, on the site where there was a large 'til' tree whose wood was used in a Castilian warship. In 1754, Captain Roque João Acciaioly was the constable. Sold by the Ministry of War, it gave way to a large warehouse.

D. Jerónimo Fernando: Ordered the construction of the Fort of S. Felipe da Praça
Captain Roque João Acciaioly: Was the constable of the Fort of S. Felipe da Praça in 1754

1628: Fort of S. Felipe da Praça was ordered to be built by the bishop governor D. Jerónimo Fernando
1754: Captain Roque João Acciaioly was the constable of the Fort of S. Felipe da Praça
